page.title: 01MOORENDS GAZETTEER
page.content: MOORENDS GAZETTEER. Moorends developed into a pit village when the pit opened in 1911. Today the majority of the people no longer work at the pit which was closed in 1956. The pit was supposed to re-open in 1982, but there have been technical and political setbacks which have kept it closed. The village has four churches: Anglican,R.C.,Jehovahs Witness and Spiritualist. There are three schools. West Road First School and Moorends First School. The children attend these from 4-9yrs then continue their education at Marshland Middle School. At 13yrs all the children go to the Comprehensive School at Thorne. In the village there are two shopping areas, one along Marshland Road and the other at the circle
